actors.name: Clive Polles
actors.organisation: Grove Park Terrace Surgery / Glebe Street Surgery

conduct.description: Refused to authorise replacement buprenorphine patch without clinical authority
Made 'off the books' calls from personal mobile to patient's mother
Made false claims about medication quantities (disprovable by father's collection records)
Referenced by Dr Gorrie re: 'sketchy stuff' that blocked practice merger
conduct.evidenceSource: Patient testimony re: Dr Gorrie statement

actors.legalSignificance: Non-clinical staff making clinical decisions about medication. Pattern of conduct outside normal administrative boundaries. Use of personal phone avoids audit trail.

actors.name: Dr Bulale Ali
actors.organisation: Grove Park Terrace Surgery / Glebe Street Surgery

conduct.description: Recorded patient was 'sleeping pain-free' - CONTRADICTED by contemporaneous evidence
Applied Somatoform Pain Disorder during telephone call about opioid switching - NOT a psychiatric assessment
Used wrong ICD-10 code (E278 instead of F45.4)
Did not inform patient of psychiatric diagnosis being added to record

actors.legalSignificance: Psychiatric diagnosis applied without assessment, without patient knowledge, AFTER MRI proved physical fractures. No responsible body of medical opinion would support this.

actors.name: Dr Sian Morgan
actors.organisation: Grove Park Terrace Surgery / Glebe Street Surgery

conduct.description: Recorded 'the main issue here is opaite [sic] addiction' with NO toxicology testing
Documented disbelief of patient: 'Pulse 100 - I'm not sure about this' re stimulant denial
No toxicology testing ever performed despite documenting addiction concerns

actors.legalSignificance: Addiction diagnosis for prescribed medication without objective evidence. No drug testing performed despite documenting addiction concerns. Defamatory entry on permanent medical record. Contradicted by 2-year documented cardiac history showing baseline tachycardia.

actors.name: Dr Richard Drewry
actors.organisation: Grove Park Terrace Surgery / Glebe Street Surgery

conduct.description: First invoked patient's deceased brother Dorian in relation to care
Documented disbelief that patient had cranial surgery
Ceased Oxycontin without taper, instructed OTC Co-codamol
Accused patient of 'lying' about instruction - DISPROVED by pharmacy
Failed to investigate sensory loss after third-degree burn

actors.legalSignificance: First documented use of family tragedy to dismiss physical symptoms. Multiple BNF/GMC breaches. False accusation disproved by pharmacy records. Failed to investigate neurological red flags.

actors.name: Dr Arun Bhaskar
actors.organisation: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust - Charing Cross Hospital

conduct.description: Rejected pain referral citing suicide concern without ever seeing patient
Misrepresented neurology review - cited headache clinic letter as if it assessed back pain
Applied 'functional neurological disorder' label based on A&E mischaracterisation

actors.legalSignificance: PROVEN MISREPRESENTATION - Cited headache clinic letter as evidence about back pain to BLOCK pain clinic review. 10 weeks before December 2021 seizure. No Bolam defence available.

actors.name: Dr Kushan Karunaratne

conduct.description: Verbally stated 'data manipulation' regarding GP care issues (parents witnessed)
Documented 14-month sleep deprivation at first epilepsy assessment
Documented severe physical symptoms 2 days before GP applied Somatoform
Stated 'medical explanations have been found for symptoms'
Formally diagnosed 'Epilepsy with generalised seizures'

actors.legalSignificance: CRITICAL WITNESS - Independent NHS specialist raising concerns about GP conduct. 'Data manipulation' statement with witnesses. Key vindication evidence documented across multiple clinic letters.

actors.name: Dr Alexander Gorrie

conduct.description: Marked Somatoform diagnosis as INACTIVE - noted 'there were clear causes for his pain'
First GP to properly recognise seizure/fracture chronology and refer to orthopaedics
Referenced 'sketchy stuff' about Clive Polles that blocked practice merger

actors.legalSignificance: CRITICAL VINDICATION - Subsequent NHS clinician independently determined psychiatric diagnosis inappropriate. Internal NHS vindication, not litigation-driven.
actors.notes: Current treating physician - relationship must be preserved. Any request for formal statement must be handled sensitively.

actors.name: Sumeer Bhamm
actors.organisation: Imperial College Healthcare - Charing Cross Hospital

conduct.description: Documented: 'issues with GP, as they did not believe his pain and accused him for attention seeking'
Documented Pain Clinic rejected referral without speaking to patient directly
Conducted own assessment: patient 'assures me he is not suicidal but just struggling to manage pain'

actors.legalSignificance: CRITICAL EVIDENCE - Third-party contemporaneous documentation of GP dismissal pattern PREDATING December 2021 seizure. Independent clinician advocating for patient.

actors.name: Jason Parry

conduct.description: RARE FACE-TO-FACE EXAMINATION documenting visible physical signs: paraspinal muscle spasm, lumbar stiffness, reduced core stability
Confirmed October 2020 pain onset; documented 'struggling to sleep as a result of back pain'

actors.legalSignificance: BASELINE - Documents VISIBLE physical signs 5 months before seizure. Independently confirms October 2020 pain onset and sleep disruption. One of very few documented physical examinations.

actors.name: Dr Sara Simeoni

conduct.description: Explicitly documented: 'Has never been reviewed by the FND team at St George's'
Documented: 'When had a seizure pregabalin had been stopped abruptly'
Documented Baclofen 90% effective for tremor (challenges functional tremor label)

actors.legalSignificance: Key vindication evidence - Confirmed FND label applied without formal assessment. Documented direct pregabalin cessation â†’ seizure causation.

actors.name: Dr Amit Gupta

conduct.description: Made MH1 referral with somatisation framing - linked brother's suicide to 'somatisation'

actors.legalSignificance: First documented 'somatisation' framing in referral BEFORE key injury events. Created contamination pathway for later clinicians.

actors.name: Mr Hamid Hassany

conduct.description: Discharged patient because LUMBAR MRI normal - stated 'no surgical target'
Acknowledged 'MRI findings does not explain his severe back pain' but discharged anyway

actors.legalSignificance: CRITICAL DIAGNOSTIC FAILURE - Wrong spinal region imaged. THORACIC fractures discovered 8 months later when thoracic spine finally scanned.

actors.name: Patient's Parents

witnessedEvents.event: Clive Polles mobile phone calls to mother

actors.legalSignificance: Key witnesses to multiple critical events. Father's records disprove Polles' medication claims. Can provide gratuitous care evidence for quantum.

actors.name: Dr Priya Khemani

conduct.description: Noted 'CT head - NAD' but failed to order spinal imaging despite 'severe back pain'
Relied on brain/lung imaging to dismiss thoracic spine injury
Noted '?seizure' but failed to add SNOMED code to problem list

actors.legalSignificance: False assurance - Cited irrelevant imaging as reassurance. Contributed to 10-month delay in diagnosing T5-T8 fractures.

actors.name: Dr Glennis Williams

conduct.description: Pregabalin 600mg abruptly stopped violating BNF taper guidance

actors.legalSignificance: 4-month medication void contributed to seizure risk. Critical for F050 causation chain.
